Items for Review and discuss at next meeting:
Review Principle Contractors (PC) proposed baseline program
Upload to ALL necessary QA platforms
All SWMS soft copies signed & hard copy printed & filed in the ‘on site’ paper folder
1. Administrative, training and risk management requirements

1.1 - So far as reasonably practicable, all workers carrying out construction work on the project have been made aware of the content of the WHS management plan, including any updates, and their right to inspect the plan.
1.2 - All workers carrying out construction work have received the general construction induction training.
1.3 - Workers have been informed of the site-specific health and safety rules.
1.4 - Suitable and adequate information, training, and instruction has been provided to workers in relation to work they are carrying out.
1.5 - Personal protective equipment (PPE) is being worn in accordance with the projects requirements.
2.1 - A safe work method statement (SWMS) has been prepared for each high risk construction work activity that is underway or about to commence.
2.2 - Workers have reviewed and signed off on the relevant SWMS
2.3 - High risk construction work activities are being carried out in accordance with the relevant SWMS.
3.1 - The work environment has been maintained such that it is clean and in a safe condition.
3.2 - Work areas are clearly identified and separated as necessary so that work can be undertaken safely.
3.3 - Lighting at the workplace is sufficient to allow:
○ Each worker to carry out work without risk to health and safety.
○ People to move within the workplace without risk to health and safety.
3.4 - The workplace has sufficient ventilation to enable workers to carry out work without risk to health and safety.
3.5 - The entries, exits, and access ways in the workplace are kept clean and clear of materials and waste.
3.6 - A safe system has been implemented for the collection, storage, and disposal of excess or waste materials.
3.7 - Sufficient area has been allocated to safely store materials or plant for the construction work.
3.8 - Protruding objects that are a hazard have been made safe (e.g. exposed nails, vertical reinforcing steel).
3.9 - Adequate facilities have been provided for workers, including toilets, drinking water, washing facilities, and eating facilities.
3.10 - First aid equipment has been provided for the workplace and is accessible to each worker.
4.1 - For each hazard associated with a confined space, a competent person completed ASSES-05 Confined Spaces Risk.
4.2 - Prior to commencing the works, FORM-003 Entry Permit Confined Spaces has been completed and approved.
4.3 - Appropriate signage has been erected for all confined spaces.

4.4 - First aid procedures and rescue procedures to be followed in accordance with POLICY-006 Confined Spaces Rescue in the event of an emergency in a confined space have been developed and practiced to ensure they are efficient and effective.
4.5 - Workers required to work in or around a confined space have been provided with information, instruction, and training in relation to the:
○ Nature of all hazards relating to a confined space
○ Need for, and the appropriate use of, control measures associated with those hazards
○ Selection, fit, use, wearing, testing, storage, and maintenance of any personal protective equipment
○ Contents of any confined space entry permits that may be issued
5.1 - A SWMS is available for all high risk construction work that involves a risk of a person falling more than 2m that has commenced or is about to commence.
5.2 - Where a risk of fall of less than 2m exists:
○ Each hazard that may result in a fall or cause death or injury if a person were to fall has been identified
○ The risk of death or injury that may result because of the hazard has been assessed
○ Any control measures necessary to prevent, or minimise the level of, exposure to the risk is used.
5.3 - Where a risk of fall of at least 2m exists, control measures have been used which:
○ Prevent a person falling any distance
– prevent or minimise the risk of death or injury to a person when the fall is arrested.
5.4 - Ladders are not used to support a weight greater than that for which they have been designed.
○ Bottom of the ladder is on a stable surface
○ Rungs of the ladder are approximately level.
5.6 - Scaffolding has been erected by appropriately licensed workers.
5.7 - Scaffolding is or has been erected and/or dismantled so as to eliminate or minimise the risk of falling at least 2m to people carrying out the work, in accordance with the regulations
5.8 - Safe access to and egress from scaffold has been provided during erection, use, and dismantling.
5.9 - Written confirmation from a competent person stating that the construction of a particular scaffold has been completed, has been obtained prior to the use of that particular scaffold.
5.10 - REGISTER-007 Plant and Equipment is up to date and includes all mobile plant in use.
5.11 - CHECK-004 Pre-Start Plant and Equipment has been completed for all mobile plant in use on delivery to site.
5.12 - CHECK-005 Regular Plant and Equipment has been completed for all mobile plant prior to commencing operation of the plant that day.
5.13 - Mobile plant operators hold the appropriate high risk work licence.
5.14 - Where there is a possibility of powered mobile plant colliding with pedestrians or other powered mobile plant, a warning device has been fitted.
6.1 - Electrical leads are arranged to avoid damage.
6.2 - Electrical equipment has been inspected, testing, and tagged in accordance with AS/NZS 3012 Electrical installations – Construction and demolition sites.
7.1 - All hazardous chemicals that are used, handled, or stored at the workplace are correctly labelled.
7.2 - A safety data sheet (SDS) exists and is available for inspection for each hazardous chemical used, handled, or stored at the workplace.
7.3 - A register of hazardous chemicals used, handled, or stored at the workplace has been prepared in accordance with the regulations and is kept at the workplace.
7.4 - A spill containment system has been implemented in each part of the workplace where there is a risk from a spill or leak of a hazardous chemical.
This workplace inspection checklist has been completed by;
I hereby certify that all corrective actions as identified in the above checklist have been completed;
